title: 250th Anniversary of the Founding of the United States Marine Corps
summary: Proclamation 10990 of November 10, 2025, commemorates the 250th anniversary of the United States Marine Corps. The proclamation highlights the Marines' historical significance since their founding on November 10, 1775, by the Second Continental Congress. It details their pivotal roles in various conflicts, from the American Revolution to the Global War on Terror, and their dedication to defending liberty and justice. The Battle of Iwo Jima is specifically mentioned as a testament to their valor, where 22 Marines received the Medal of Honor. The proclamation also emphasizes the current administration's commitment to modernizing and strengthening the Marine Corps, with over $150 billion allocated for shipbuilding, missile defense, and advanced capabilities to ensure military readiness. It calls for the display of the U.S. flag and appropriate ceremonies to honor the Marines' heritage.
